desc.p: The company from which the transactions are to be published.
transactions can be published from any company within the publishing entity(in GAC setup).
If an attempt is made to publish to the source company in the publishing entity then the ofs string will not be created and no error message will be generated.
ALL indicating all the companies in the publishing entity.
Any number of characters followed by three dots signifying all companies with those leading characters. For example GB for all GB companies.
1-11 alphanumeric characters.
9 character valid company.
Mandatory input.
Indicates the name of the field in the APPLN.NAME to be tested or a subroutine to test for publication.

When it is the name of a field, it is used together with Fields DATA.COMPARISON to TO.DATA.It specifies precisely which records may be published from the application specified in the corresponding APPLN.NAME.A record may only be published if the field indicated here has a value allowed in the corresponding Fields DATA.COMPARISON to TO.DATA.
To use @ID, the field name corresponding to the @ID should be used.For example for the application, PERIODIC.INTEREST, REF.CCY.DATE must be used instead of @ID.
If the flag returns a value, the transaction is published, if it returns null, the transaction is not published.
If a subroutine is used,
1 35 alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory input).
A valid field name in the APPLN.NAME or a subroutine.
Multi-value field associated with Fields FROM.COMPANY to TO.DIRECTORY.
If a subroutine is used,
routine name must start with @, the text after the @ must be a valid record on the PGM.FILE.
Indicates a particular Version that may be used to publish records for the Application entered in the corresponding APPLN.NAME.The field names of the ofs string is based on this version.
A valid VERSION in the publishing entity.
0-50 alphanumeric characters beginning with ','.(Mandatory input).
Multi-value field associated with Fields
jBASE or UniVerse account of receiving entity(in GAC setup).This field is for information purpose.
0 50 alphanumeric characters
Indicates a particular version in the entity to which records are to be published. The ofs string that is created uses this version. If it is left bank, it defaults to the EXTRACT.VERSION
Valid VERSION format.
0-50 alphanumeric characters beginning with ','
Multi-value field associated with Fields
Company to which transaction is to be published.Can be in the same entity or another entity(GAC setup).
Valid COMPANY format of 2A7N(2 alphabets followed by 7 numerals)
Mandatory input.
Specifies the end of a range of values with which the contents of the field indicated in SELECT.FIELD.NAME are to be compared.
It may only be input if corresponding DATA.COMPARISON contains EQ (Equal To) or NE (Not Equal To).
Must not be less than DATA.FROM.
Multi-value field associated with Fields FROM.COMPANY to TO.DIRECTORY.
0-55 alphanumeric characters.(Mandatory input if SELECT.FIELD.NAME is a valid field name in the APPLN.NAME, otherwise input is not allowed).
Describes the OFS.PUBLISH record.
This field can be expanded to allow the user to enter the description in various languages. Each
Mandatory input.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Name of the OFS.PUBLISH record.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
T24 application that must be published. Each application has only one record. Duplicates are not possible.
For each OFS.PUBLISH record, the system will automatically update the internal/concat file "APPLICATION.PUBLISH"
A T24 application of type H, or L.
Mandatory input.
No duplicates allowed.
The type of comparison operator to be used between the contents of the field indicated in SELECT.FIELD.NAME and the values specified in Fields DATA.FROM and DATA.TO.
EQ, GE, GT, LE, LT, NE, LK, UL or no input. (Mandatory input if SELECT.FIELD.NAME(Field 4) is a valid field name in the APPLN.NAME, otherwise input is not allowed).
Multi-value field associated with Fields FROM.COMPANY to TO.DIRECTORY.
The value, or start of a range of values, with which the contents of the field indicated in SELECT.FIELD.NAME are to be compared.
1-55 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory input if SELECT.FIELD.NAME is a valid field name in the APPLN.NAME, otherwise input is not allowed).
Input must begin and/or end with 3 dots when DATA.COMPARISON = 'LK' or 'UL'.
Multi-value field associated with Fields
FROM.COMPANY to TO.DIRECTORY.
